entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (11)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (11)20130112
I played most of the morning today and made a lot of progress. I
got to the first town in Fendel. It's interesting how Fendel is
basically a cross between Russia and Germany.

I'm really enjoying all of Pascal's crazy dialogue; she's
actually funny. There was also a great skit with Sophie where she
thought she recognized peaches: once everyone was excited, she
said they reminded her of little butts. ;)

I've decided to go back through earlier parts of the game and
write down all my pending requests so I can keep an eye on them.

Along the way, I decided to complete the Arena---although I did
it only Easy. The last boss was really tough.

Total time: 28:37
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Yours, Mine & Ours, starring Dennis Quaid and Rene Russo (2005)
entry.content:
Movie: Yours, Mine & Ours, starring Dennis Quaid and Rene Russo (2005)20130112
This was a super cute and fun movie. I liked it much more than the
similar Cheaper By The Dozen. There was a lot that was very sweet
and heart-warming about it. I most enjoyed the nobility of the
Admiral and his family.
  • Movies
  • 2005

entry.title: Game: Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury (X360, 2011) (14)
entry.content:
Game: Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury (X360, 2011) (14)20130111
This afternoon I did an hour. and beat Stage 46. Later in the day,
I spent about an hour on Stage 47 and didn't beat it.

Stage 46 --- This level was super tough to get the various pieces
of the timing down. The Napalm shooting tanks roughly half-way
through were the worst, then the Longai-O at the end was pretty
tough.

Stage 47 --- This level took a few tries to get to the end, but
now I can get to the end without even thinking. It's so
frustrating and unfair though, because I spend about three
minutes getting a chance at the final boss... who kills me in 5
seconds. It's ridiculous. I don't have any opportunity to even
practice and learn in a meaningful way. It almost makes me want
to not do it, it's so insulting. Ugh!

Total time: 20:38
  • Video Games
  • Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury
  • X360
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (10)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (10)20130111
I played for about an hour today and got to Warrior's Roost. I
feel like I should have stayed at the Ruins and grinded a little
more. In most games, it doesn't take long to level or gain other
benefits in an area, then I assume that I should grind there until
the benefits stop flowing. In this game, the turn-around time for
gaining a Title level, etc, is so short that it seems like I
should always be doing it.

Total time: 24:26

  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (11)
entry.content:
Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (11)20130111
When I was reading today about ballet in post-WWII Britain, I came
across the strange discussion of /The Invitation/, a 1960 ballet by
the Royal Ballet Touring Company that featured a re-enacted rape
scene on stage. There's a footnote about how ballet was technically
not under the purview of the censors. As an example:

"In August 1960, representatives from the Lord Chamberlin's
office attended a performance of /Les Ballets Africains/ to
determine if the production was ballet or theatre. If ballet,
bare breasts were permissible; if theatre, strictly
forbidden. The authorities agreed it was a ballet---and the
press had a field day with photos." (pg. 433)

How strange.
  • Books
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury (X360, 2011) (13)
entry.content:
Game: Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury (X360, 2011) (13)20130110
I played for about 20 minutes this morning.

Stage 43 --- I finally beat this after a few tries. I actually
beat it the first time I got to the Longai-O today. It was very
scary and I had to get up and walk around to get my heart to stop
racing.

Stage 44 --- I got to the end of this level on my first try today
and had just a few more hits needed on the Big Bot before it
died, but I wasn't quick enough staying behind its back and it
got me. I think I should have stopped, froze it, and hit it with
a Counter. I'll do that when I play again today.

--

Later in the day I played for another forty-ish minutes.

Stage 44 --- I beat this after a few more tries. The first time I
got to the Big Bot I got him, but it took a while to get there
because I was a bit sloppy.

Stage 45 --- This level took a long time to do. Eventually I
settled on a single Dash to double Freeze to Counter attack. It
was very subtle to get right, but I did it.

I think there's just 47 Stages in the Fury mode. Almost there!

Total time: 18:46
  • Video Games
  • Bangai-O HD: Missile Fury
  • X360
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Hot Shots Golf: World Invitational (Vita, 2012) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Hot Shots Golf: World Invitational (Vita, 2012) (9)20130110
I decided to take this off my list because I haven't played it in
so long and when I think about playing it, it makes me mad
because it's so hard to know what a good strategy would be.

Part of me feels like the game requires you to understand
something about golf... because it doesn't give you any assistance
understanding what will happen because of the wind, ground
curvature, or grass length, etc---but requires you to figure it
out. I don't find that my intuition for that stuff is growing.

Nevertheless, I definitely have fond memories of playing the game
and I think that it is very well made, so I think deserves a high
ranking.

Total time: 12:30
  • Video Games
  • Hot Shots Golf: World Invitational
  • Vita
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (9)20130109
This afternoon I explored the Desert Ruins and fought the boss
there that Richard brought. It was incredibly difficult on Evil
and I tried many times with different strategies before adopting a
Heal-All-The-Time strategy and dropping to just Hard difficulty. I
felt like a little bit of a wuss, but won on my first try at the
new level. The combat is pretty brutal at this level.

Total time: 23:30

entry.title: Movie: Jiro Dreams of Sushi, by David Gelb (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: Jiro Dreams of Sushi, by David Gelb (2011)20130109
I didn't have high expectations for this movie, because I didn't
really have expectations at all. After we watched it, I wanted to
save up to go to this place some day and eat sushi right now. It
was amazingly engrossing for such a strange subject. I enjoyed it
a lot and liked to see the little things that they thought made
their practice different. My favourite parts were probably...
- The octopus crawling up the dude.
- The apprentice talking about making 200 egg sushi that were
rejected over four months.
- The rice dealer talking about how he wouldn't sell his rice to
the Hyatt because they wouldn't be able to cook it.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (8)20130108
This afternoon I played for about three hours. I got into the
tempering sub-system and it seems like it will be very
significant, but, of course, it means I have much fewer resources
for buying and building other things.

I got to the Rockgagong and thought the dialogue in there was
awesome. Being on the Evil difficult got really brutal once I was
inside too and I needed to switch my strategy around to have
Cheria and Sophie constantly healing.

--

Later in the day, I played for another hour or so and finished
the Rockgagong dungeon. The boss was very tough on Evil,
particularly when there were lots of parasites. I think I used 4
Life Bottles in a row when they first appeared before I thinned
the crowd a bit.

Exploring Yu *REDACTED*erte was fun and the conversation with the
president was neat. But, I think the voice actor doesn't sound
the part at all though.

Total time: 21:33
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (6)20130106
I played for about three hours this morning. I was very excited
by the development of Richard's punkish character and how
Sophie's memories were returned. I think Cheria's progression is
really adorable and I'm excited to see what happens.

Mechanically, I feel like the battles are getting a lot harder
and I'm trying to use the cooking system in a more complex way
too. I'm beginning to really understand the combo system and how
to get good strings out of it.

Total time: 15:37
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (5)20130105
Today I played for about three hours and progressed the story a
lot. I think I can tell what is happening... Richard much be
possessed by the demon from the beginning. The combat is still
good. I'm spending most of the time in Hard mode, but if I die
against a mob, I grind and if I die against a boss, I drop to
Moderate for the fight. I want to unlock the harder difficulties.

--

Later in the day, I played a bit more and got Richard his kingdom
back. In the fight against Victoria, I did it on Hard, but Asbel
died at the last second of the battle and I couldn't heal him (it
was like... frames apart) and so he didn't get any experience! I
was tempted to restart it but decided not to. I had to fight
Cedric many times and eventually dropped it to Normal rather than
grinding. I felt a little dirty.

I really like the Cooking system. It's very cute and I like how
it works mechanically.

Total time: 12:35
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Resident Evil: Retribution, starring Milla Jovovich (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Resident Evil: Retribution, starring Milla Jovovich (2012)20130105
This movie was nuts, big, and stupid like all the other Resident
Evil movies. The setup is crazy, absurd, and retcons everything of
the past ones... for example, apparently every star of the past
movies is a clone! (This is to be able to have tons of cameos.) My
favourite part of the clone thing is when Becky says to Michelle
Rodriguez #3 that she met "her sister (and she wasn't very
nice)". Hah!

It's brilliant and so dumb that they were able to create a video
game-style "level" setup with the various test sites. Strangely,
it is so reminiscent of the first one, it's one of the best. I
think Alice's care for Becky is sweet.

The final sequence is insane and Wesker is ridiculous and annoying
as usual. I wonder what will happen next?

This review blurb is great: ``Clark Collis from Entertainment
Weekly also gave the film a mostly positive review, stating that
"writer-director W.S. Anderson's overseeing of the Resident Evil
zombie franchise has proven to be both lunatically haphazard and
dementedly enthusiastic."''
  • Movies
  • 2012
